definition[0]: the same all through or in every part
example[0]: an isotherm  (=line joining places of equal temperature)
definition[1]: (International Standards Organization) an international organization which sets standards for the size, shape, and technical features of industrial goods, electrical products etc. ISO has members in more than 70 countries. Its full name is the International Organization for Standardization.
definition[2]: the name used internationally for the International Organization for Standardization, whose purpose is to establish international standards for services, goods and industrial methods
definition[3]: the ISO’s quality standard for companies producing goods
example[1]: The process of qualifying for ISO 9000 will improve organizations’ quality systems.
definition[4]: the ISO’s quality standards for companies providing services
example[2]: The bank’s clearing system was the first in the world to be awarded an ISO 9002 certificate.
definition[5]: the ISO’s quality standard for subjects relating to the environment and RECYCLING (=using materials more than once)
